name: indistinctly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not clear: He mumbled indistinctly, and I couldn’t tell what he wanted. The mangroves beyond the stream loomed indistinctly through the morning haze. See
indistinct
More examplesFewer examplesThe musical accompaniment competes with the actors, who tend to speak too quietly and indistinctly anyway.The track runs, sometimes indistinctly, through stunted bush and occasional clearings to the tree line.They speak so rapidly and indistinctly that many of their words are lost.
